poem:
The Heart's Land  

Amidst the green spread  
of Powys fields, voices  
rise—tender roots  
in Welsh soil,  
young farmers' dreams  
woven through ancient  
whispers. To sell, to sever—  
a tongue in threat,  
an earth in plea—  
holding fast,  
the words linger  
on the wind's  
breath, searching  
for sustenance anew.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Farmers fight to save estate at heart of Powys Welsh-speaking community Farmers and agricultural unions are fighting to save a large farming estate owned by Powys council amid sell-off plans that tenants say will affect the rural Welsh-speaking community by taking away a crucial stepping stone for young farmers. A total of 19 tenants living and working on 130 smallholdings, or about 15%, have been served with notices to quit since the local authority began". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
